intro: Gaudichaudia cynanchoides f. decemglandulosa, commonly known as the ten-glandular gaudichaudia, is a rare and unique variant of the gaudichaudia genus. It is characterized by its distinctive floral structure, featuring ten prominent glands on the calyx, which is a notable botanical trait. The plant belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family, known for its milkweed-like appearance and specialized floral morphology. Its leaves are typically lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem. This variant is of interest to botanists due to its unusual morphological features and limited distribution.
